info.title: hermes
info.description: Hermes is an agent that provides Verified Prices from the Pythnet Pyth Oracle.

get.description:
**Deprecated: use /v2/updates/price/{publish_time} instead**

Get a price update for a price feed with a specific timestamp

Given a price feed id and timestamp, retrieve the Pyth price update closest to that timestamp.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the price feed to get an update for.

parameters.name: publish_time
parameters.description:
The unix timestamp in seconds. This endpoint will return the first update whose
publish_time is >= the provided value.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description:
If true, include the `metadata` field in the response with additional metadata about the
price update.

parameters.name: binary
parameters.description:
If true, include the binary price update in the `vaa` field of each returned feed. This
binary data can be submitted to Pyth contracts to update the on-chain price.

get.description:
**Deprecated: use /v2/updates/price/{publish_time} instead**

Get a VAA for a price feed with a specific timestamp

Given a price feed id and timestamp, retrieve the Pyth price update closest to that timestamp.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the price feed to get an update for.

parameters.name: publish_time
parameters.description:
The unix timestamp in seconds. This endpoint will return the first update whose
publish_time is >= the provided value.

get.description:
**Deprecated: use /v2/updates/price/{publish_time} instead**

Get a VAA for a price feed using CCIP

This endpoint accepts a single argument which is a hex-encoded byte string of the following form:
`<price feed id (32 bytes> <publish time as unix timestamp (8 bytes, big endian)>`

**Deprecated: use /v2/updates/price/latest instead**

Get the latest price updates by price feed id.

Given a collection of price feed ids, retrieve the latest Pyth price for each price feed.

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description:
Get the most recent price update for this set of price feed ids.

This parameter can be provided multiple times to retrieve multiple price updates,
for example see the following query string:

```
?ids[]=a12...&ids[]=b4c...
```

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description:
If true, include the `metadata` field in the response with additional metadata about
the price update.

parameters.name: binary
parameters.description:
If true, include the binary price update in the `vaa` field of each returned feed.
This binary data can be submitted to Pyth contracts to update the on-chain price.

get.description:
**Deprecated: use /v2/updates/price/latest instead**

Get VAAs for a set of price feed ids.

Given a collection of price feed ids, retrieve the latest VAA for each. The returned VAA(s) can
be submitted to the Pyth contract to update the on-chain price. If VAAs are not found for every
provided price ID the call will fail.

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description:
Get the VAAs for this set of price feed ids.

This parameter can be provided multiple times to retrieve multiple price updates,
for example see the following query string:

```
?ids[]=a12...&ids[]=b4c...
```

get.description:
**Deprecated: use /v2/price_feeds instead**

Get the set of price feed IDs.

This endpoint fetches all of the price feed IDs for which price updates can be retrieved.

get.summary: Get the set of price feeds.
get.description:
Get the set of price feeds.

This endpoint fetches all price feeds from the Pyth network. It can be filtered by asset type
and query string.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Optional query parameter. If provided, the results will be filtered to all price feeds whose symbol contains the query string. Query string is case insensitive.

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Optional query parameter. If provided, the results will be filtered by asset type. Possible values are crypto, equity, fx, metal, rates. Filter string is case insensitive.

get.summary: Get the latest price updates by price feed id.
get.description:
Get the latest price updates by price feed id.

Given a collection of price feed ids, retrieve the latest Pyth price for each price feed.

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description:
Get the most recent price update for this set of price feed ids.

This parameter can be provided multiple times to retrieve multiple price updates,
for example see the following query string:

```
?ids[]=a12...&ids[]=b4c...
```

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Optional encoding type. If true, return the price update in the encoding specified by the encoding parameter. Default is `hex`.

parameters.name: parsed
parameters.description: If true, include the parsed price update in the `parsed` field of each returned feed. Default is `true`.

parameters.name: ignore_invalid_price_ids
parameters.description: If true, invalid price IDs in the `ids` parameter are ignored. Only applicable to the v2 APIs. Default is `false`.

get.summary: SSE route handler for streaming price updates.
get.description: SSE route handler for streaming price updates.

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description:
Get the most recent price update for this set of price feed ids.

This parameter can be provided multiple times to retrieve multiple price updates,
for example see the following query string:

```
?ids[]=a12...&ids[]=b4c...
```

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Optional encoding type. If true, return the price update in the encoding specified by the encoding parameter. Default is `hex`.

parameters.name: parsed
parameters.description: If true, include the parsed price update in the `parsed` field of each returned feed. Default is `true`.

parameters.name: allow_unordered
parameters.description: If true, allows unordered price updates to be included in the stream.

parameters.name: benchmarks_only
parameters.description: If true, only include benchmark prices that are the initial price updates at a given timestamp (i.e., prevPubTime != pubTime).

parameters.name: ignore_invalid_price_ids
parameters.description: If true, invalid price IDs in the `ids` parameter are ignored. Only applicable to the v2 APIs. Default is `false`.

get.summary: Get the most recent publisher stake caps update data.
get.description: Get the most recent publisher stake caps update data.

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description:
Get the most recent publisher stake caps update data.
Optional encoding type. If true, return the message in the encoding specified by the encoding parameter. Default is `hex`.

parameters.name: parsed
parameters.description: If true, include the parsed update in the `parsed` field of each returned feed. Default is `true`.

200.description: Publisher stake caps update data retrieved successfully

get.summary: Get the latest TWAP by price feed id with a custom time window.
get.description:
Get the latest TWAP by price feed id with a custom time window.

Given a collection of price feed ids, retrieve the latest Pyth TWAP price for each price feed.

parameters.name: window_seconds
parameters.description:
The time window in seconds over which to calculate the TWAP, ending at the current time.
For example, a value of 300 would return the most recent 5 minute TWAP.
Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 600 seconds (10 minutes).

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description:
Get the most recent TWAP (time weighted average price) for this set of price feed ids.
The `binary` data contains the signed start & end cumulative price updates needed to calculate
the TWAPs on-chain. The `parsed` data contains the calculated TWAPs.

This parameter can be provided multiple times to retrieve multiple price updates,
for example see the following query string:

```
?ids[]=a12...&ids[]=b4c...
```

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Optional encoding type. If true, return the cumulative price updates in the encoding specified by the encoding parameter. Default is `hex`.

parameters.name: parsed
parameters.description: If true, include the calculated TWAP in the `parsed` field of each returned feed. Default is `true`.

parameters.name: ignore_invalid_price_ids
parameters.description: If true, invalid price IDs in the `ids` parameter are ignored. Only applicable to the v2 APIs. Default is `false`.

vaa.description: The VAA binary represented as a base64 string.

down_slots_ratio.description:
The % of slots where the network was down over the TWAP window.
A value of zero indicates no slots were missed over the window, and
a value of one indicates that every slot was missed over the window.
This is a float value stored as a string to avoid precision loss.

end_timestamp.description: The end unix timestamp of the window

start_timestamp.description: The start unix timestamp of the window

PriceIdInput.description:
A price id is a 32-byte hex string, optionally prefixed with "0x".
Price ids are case insensitive.

Examples:
* 0xe62df6c8b4a85fe1a67db44dc12de5db330f7ac66b72dc658afedf0f4a415b43
* e62df6c8b4a85fe1a67db44dc12de5db330f7ac66b72dc658afedf0f4a415b43

See https://pyth.network/developers/price-feed-ids for a list of all price feed ids.

RpcPrice.description:
A price with a degree of uncertainty at a certain time, represented as a price +- a confidence
interval.

The confidence interval roughly corresponds to the standard error of a normal distribution.
Both the price and confidence are stored in a fixed-point numeric representation, `x *
10^expo`, where `expo` is the exponent. For example:

conf.description: The confidence interval associated with the price, stored as a string to avoid precision loss

expo.description:
The exponent associated with both the price and confidence interval. Multiply those values
by `10^expo` to get the real value.

price.description: The price itself, stored as a string to avoid precision loss

publish_time.description:
When the price was published. The `publish_time` is a unix timestamp, i.e., the number of
seconds since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 Jan 1970).

vaa.description: The VAA binary represented as a base64 string.

parsed.description: The calculated TWAPs for each price ID
